item.title: 3 Major Final Fantasy Games Are Expected to Get Xbox Announcements Soon
item.description:
Summary

  • Xbox insider Jez Corden predicts the upcoming Xbox Showcase may feature Final Fantasy 16, Final Fantasy 7 Remake, and Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth.
  • Final Fantasy games that were originally PlayStation-exclusive may soon be coming to Xbox as part of a new multi-platform strategy.
  • Square Enix's shift to multi-platform releases could mean new Final Fantasy games could launch on Xbox at the same time as PlayStation.

A recent report hints that three major Final Fantasy games will soon be announced for Xbox. The Final Fantasy franchise has traditionally been aligned with PlayStation platforms, especially in recent years, with major entries like Final Fantasy 16 and the Final Fantasy 7 Remake series skipping Xbox entirely. As Xbox continues to push its multi-platform strategy, that may finally be changing.

As Square Enix is a Japanese publisher, it's no surprise that it would have closer ties to Sony and give it priority when it comes to its biggest IP. This has historically been the case, with the Final Fantasy franchise being synonymous with PlayStation since the original PlayStation console. The first Final Fantasy game to launch on the PS1 was Final Fantasy 7 , and Sony has held exclusive rights to most of the Final Fantasy titles since. Even so, that hasn’t stopped rumors about a PS5-exclusive Final Fantasy game coming to Xbox from floating around since early 2025.

In a recent article, Xbox insider Jez Corden laid out his expectations for the upcoming Xbox Showcase on June 8. The article outlines several confident predictions for the show, notably suggesting that Final Fantasy 16 , Final Fantasy 7 Remake , and Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth could be arriving on Xbox very soon. Although this isn’t confirmation, Corden has a strong track record with Xbox news, and enough time has passed that this wouldn’t be all that surprising.

Final Fantasy Games May be Heading to Xbox

All three major titles have seen PC releases not long after their initial launch on PlayStation consoles. Even the Nintendo Switch 2 is confirmed to be getting Final Fantasy 7 Remake before any word on an Xbox release. With Xbox leaning so heavily into its Game Pass subscription, players may even see all three titles drop on the service at the same time.

If this rumor turns out to be true, the final installment in the remake trilogy may be released simultaneously across all three major platforms, something that could certainly help boost sales. It's possible that, given Square Enix's recent multi-platform shift, whatever exclusivity deal was in place for the Final Fantasy franchise might finally be coming to an end. That would be good timing for Xbox, especially with Square Enix recently hinting that a Final Fantasy 9 remake is in the works. Xbox fans might be in for a treat if the franchise is truly making its return, and they’ve certainly waited long enough.

item.title: Should Far Cry Get Its Own Version of Assassin’s Creed Infinity?
item.description:
The Far Cry franchise has been a staple of Ubisoft's portfolio for over 20 years, and it often receives new installments on a near-annual basis. Lately, however, the series has taken a backseat. The last mainline Far Cry game, 2021's Far Cry 6 , was released nearly 4 years ago. This is the longest time that Ubisoft has gone without launching a new entry in the franchise. While Ubisoft has rummaged through its back catalog and released 60 FPS patches for some of the older Far Cry installments, it has remained conspicuously silent about the franchise's overall future.

Some fans are hoping that the Far Cry series' extended hiatus will give Ubisoft the opportunity to go back to the drawing board and reinvent the franchise. Far Cry 6 , as popular as it was, wasn't exactly a fan favorite among the dedicated Far Cry community. Many players, in addition to critics and journalists, believed that the game was too derivative for its own good and didn't do enough to stand out from previous Far Cry installments. The next Far Cry game is apparently going to depart significantly from the series' established formula, if rumors are to be believed, so it looks like this feedback is actually being taken into account.

Far Cry 7 Doesn't Really Need an Animus Hub

Far Cry 7 is Apparently Going to Take Some Inspiration from Assassin's Creed Infinity

Shortly after the release of Far Cry 6 , insiders claimed in 2021 that the next mainline entry in the Far Cry series, Far Cry 7 , would use a live service business model, akin to the then-upcoming Assassin's Creed Infinity . The prospect of a live-service Far Cry game was immediately met with backlash by fans. However, subsequent reports alleged that the series would not be taking this approach in the way that some would expect. According to Insider Gaming, Ubisoft is currently developing two new Far Cry games: a multiplayer extraction shooter set in the Alaskan wilderness, and a single-player-only title that features a Dead Rising -esque time limit.

The Far Cry extraction shooter and the Far Cry single-player title originally started life as the same game, but after their scopes grew, they were divided into separate projects.

Assassin's Creed Infinity - A.K.A. The Animus Hub - is a Special Interface That Connects the Latest AC Games

Even though the next mainline Far Cry game is apparently going to be single-player, it's possible that Ubisoft will still attempt to implement an Assassin's Creed Infinity -style component into it, as that 2021 report suggested. For those unaware, Assassin's Creed Infinity is the codename for the Assassin's Creed Animus Hub, which was released alongside 2025's Assassin's Creed Shadows . The Animus Hub is, in essence, a special interface that was designed as an entry point to the latest games in the AC franchise. Through the Animus Hub, players can access certain Assassin's Creed games, take on extra missions, unlock Modern Day content, and purchase rare gear, among other things.

Adding an Animus Hub-like interface to Far Cry 7 wouldn't be a terrible idea, but it's hard to argue that it'd be necessary. Ubisoft created the Animus Hub in order to link the Assassin's Creed games together, not just in terms of accessibility, but also in terms of story. The Animus Hub includes a timeline that lists the protagonists of every modern AC game and shows where they fit in the series' overarching lore. Even though the Assassin's Creed games typically follow different characters, their narratives tend to be connected to each other in some way.

The Far Cry Games Are Not As Connected As the AC Games Are

The Far Cry series, in comparison, is not nearly as interconnected as the Assassin's Creed games are. Each installment in the Far Cry franchise (excluding Far Cry: New Dawn ) is a completely standalone entry, and aside from a few recurring characters, there are barely any narrative links between them. Therefore, it wouldn't really make a lot of sense to give Far Cry 7 its own Animus Hub. Although there are a lot of things that future Far Cry games could benefit from, an extra interface probably isn't one of them.

item.title: Pokemon GO Raid Schedule for June 2025
item.description:
Pokemon GO has been around for what feels like 20 years at this point, but that doesn't mean the developers are slowing down on adding content. Each month, new Pokémon are brought into the Raid schedule, allowing trainers to team up with other players and unleash their strongest team of Pocket Monsters to take down powerful raid bosses in Pokemon GO .

If you're curious about the raid lineup for June 2025, we have a handy-dandy list below of the featured Pokemon, the timing, and whether they have a shiny variant in Pokemon GO yet.

Pokemon GO Raid Schedule for June 2025

Regi's, Altaria's, and Beedrills, oh my

item.title: PS Plus Update Adds Underrated Soulslike Game from 2024
item.description:
Summary

  • Another Crab's Treasure has been added to PS Plus Extra.
  • Another Crab's Treasure is an underrated Soulslike about a hermit crab trying to reclaim his shell.
  • More bonus PS Plus Extra games are coming soon.

The latest update to the PlayStation Plus subscription service has added underrated Soulslike game Another Crab's Treasure to the Extra tier. Typically, new games are added to the Extra and Premium tiers of PlayStation Plus near the middle of any given month, but Sony is shaking things up thanks to the ongoing Days of Play event.

To celebrate Sony's annual Days of Play event, PlayStation Plus subscribers are getting treated to bonus games across the service's various tiers. PS Plus Essential subscribers were recently treated to Destiny 2: The Final Shape expansion, while those signed up for PS Plus Extra have a variety of bonus games to look forward to between now and June 10.

Right now, PlayStation Plus subscribers signed up for the Extra or Premium tier can play Another Crab's Treasure . Another Crab's Treasure is a quirky Soulslike that was first released in 2024 about a hermit crab trying to reclaim his home. Another Crab's Treasure features all the usual hallmarks of the Soulslike genre, like tough-as-nails battles and fights against challenging bosses that push players to their limit. The game earned a 78 overall rating, which is a little low in my opinion, and is worth checking out for genre fans and those who don't normally vibe with Soulslikes.

Another Crab's Treasure is an Underrated Soulslike Now Available on PS Plus Extra

That's because Another Crab's Treasure features difficulty options, allowing players to enjoy the game at their own pace. In fact, Another Crab's Treasure lets players literally whip out a gun and one-shot every enemy they come across if they want. The game is hilarious and also features plenty of 3D platforming, which makes it a unique entry in the Soulslike pantheon.

Another Crab's Treasure is the first bonus PS Plus Extra game added as part of the Days of Play event, but there are more titles to look forward to in the near future. Skull and Bones is coming to PS Plus Extra on June 2, while Destiny 2: Legacy Collection will be added on June 4. Then, on June 5, PS Plus Premium subscribers can look forward to Myst and Riven . Finally, Grand Theft Auto 3: The Definitive Edition will be added to PS Plus Extra on June 10.

PS Plus Extra and Premium Games Coming Soon

  • Another Crab's Treasure - Available now
  • Skull and Bones - June 2
  • Destiny 2: Legacy Collection - June 4
  • Myst - June 5
  • Riven - June 5
  • Grand Theft Auto 3: The Definitive Edition - June 10

There are also the free PS Plus games for June 2025 to look forward to, available to subscribers across all three tiers. Available June 3, the free PS Plus games for June 2025 are the Alone in the Dark remake, Bomb Rush Cyberfunk , and NBA 2K25 .

item.title: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery Adding New Hogwarts Harvest Feature
item.description:
Summary

  • Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery introduces Hogwarts Harvest, allowing players to grow magical plants with Professor Sprout.
  • Players can now care for familiar flora like Venomous Tentacula, Dittany, Mimbulus Mimbletonia, and more
  • Future Hogwarts Mystery updates will include a Pride outfit giveaway, a romantic adventure, and a Hogwarts Diary event.

Celebrating the transition of spring into summer, Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery has unveiled a brand-new Hogwarts Harvest feature that will allow players to grow magical plants with Professor Sprout. Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery has received a number of unique seasonal updates, and this latest addition focuses on expanding the Herbology offerings in the hit mobile game.

First released in 2018, Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the first-ever Wizarding World video game that let players create their own character and set off on their journey through Hogwarts as a student of witchcraft and wizardry. The players compete in each of the four houses in Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery and can take advantage of special events to gain extra house points while unlocking exclusive items. With springtime flowers in full bloom, the magical title is ready to add one of the most highly requested features for players to enjoy.

The official Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery blog has announced the new Hogwarts Harvest feature, which will see players planting, nurturing, and harvesting magical plants under the guidance of the Herbology teacher, Professor Sprout. Players are invited by Professor Dumbledore and Professor Sprout to be the caretaker of a special greenhouse on the outskirts of Hogwarts, adding a brand-new area to the list of key locations in Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery . This greenhouse will be used to grow magical flora like Venomous Tentacula, Dittany, Mimbulus Mimbletonia, and more. In order to fully care for these plants, players will need to utilize the newly added fertilizer resource, which can be earned from Creature Expeditions or bought at the Hogwarts Harvest shop. Just like real plants, players will need to consistently check in on their greenhouse to ensure their magical garden stays in full bloom.

Hogwarts Harvest and More New Content Coming to Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery

The Hogwarts Harvest update is now available in Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery , and even more game expansions are on the way. Beginning June 1, players can participate in a special Pride outfit giveaway and embark on a romantic Special Adventure. A new Hogwarts Diary event will also bring exciting rewards while challenging players to find Salazar Slytherin's secret treasure. Fans can check out the Hogwarts Harvest and Pride offerings plus previous Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery Beyond Hogwarts expansions via the official mobile game app available on iOS and Android devices.

Having already celebrated its 7th anniversary, Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery seems to be showing no signs of slowing. While Hogwarts Legacy 2 is coordinating with the HBO show to bring more of the Wizarding World to life, Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery is keeping fans engaged with fresh updates and fun expansions that continue to immerse players in the world of magic.
